instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message: I don't have the electronic schematic of this board, could you make it available to me?

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message:
I don't have it.
Let us know if you see it on Internaet, even on paid websites.

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message: Post a picture of the board where you found this board number.

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message:
Sorry, the model for this board is 01958-a. I downloaded 820-01521 is not the same, but it is what  have at the moment.
This plate suffered a lot of oxidation, Q7040 and nearby components are well oxidized. The stresses I am not sure if I am measuring in the right place. L7816 and L7817 are with 34 Ohms in reference to the ground.

Voltage: PPbus_g3h 1.2 V oscillating; PP3v3_g3h I don't know where to measure, follow the attached photo.[ATTACH type="full"]59536[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message:
"the model for this board is 01958-a"
You've probably meant 01598.
Check your PM for schematic.

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message: 820-01958 is the MBA 2020 (yes Apple always has to choose confusing numbers), schematics/boardview not available yet, 820-01521 can help indeed.

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message:
PPBUS_g3h 1.108V

Well, the scheme doesn't match the layout of the board I'm repairing. With this tension can you tell me something?[ATTACH type="full"]59539[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]59540[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-01055 no power
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at R7020/60 and L7030.
Do you get any voltage at R7020?
